title: Scalar Types Are Unqualified
content: Scalar types like ``int `` or  ``iterable`` should be used without a leading slash. However, there are exceptions. In PHP 8.3, types such as  ``callable `` and  ``array`` are still misinterpreted as class names, which can result in confusing or poorly worded error messages. This inconsistency remains a known issue in the language, affecting type declarations and error reporting for these specific cases, until PHP 8.5.
